AMINOSALICYLIC ACID

  • Indications and doses
  • Pregnancy
  • Hepatic impairment
  • Renal impairment
  • Side effects
  • Administration
  • Patient and carer advice
  • Cautions
  • Monitoring requirements
  • Medicinal forms

Indications and doses

Multiple-drug resistant tuberculosis, in combination with other drugs,

By mouth

  • For adults
    4 g every 8 hours for a usual treatment duration of 24 months; maximum 12 g per day.

Desensitisation regimen,

By mouth

  • For adults
    (consult product literature).

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid unless essential—toxicity in animal studies (highest risk during first trimester).

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Use with caution.

Advice regarding renal impairment

Use with caution in mild to moderate impairment.

Avoid in severe impairment due to accumulation of inactive metabolites.

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhoea, nausea, rash, vestibular syndrome, vomiting,

uncommon: Anorexia,

rare: Gastrointestinal bleeding, hypothyroidism, jaundice, malabsorption syndrome, metallic taste, peptic ulcer, urticaria,

veryRare: Agranulocytosis, anaemia, crystalluria, dizziness, headache, hypoglycaemia, leucopenia, methemoglobinaemia, peripheral neuropathy, purpura, tendon pain, thrombocytopenia, visual abnormalities, weight loss,

notKnown: Hepatitis, hypersensitivity,

Directions for administration

Disperse granules in orange or tomato juice and take immediately (granules will not dissolve, ensure all granules are swallowed). Granules can be sprinkled on apple sauce or yoghurt for administration.

Advice for patients and carers

Patients should be advised that the skeletons of the granules may be seen in the stools.

Counselling advised on administration.

Cautions regarding administration

  • Peptic ulcer

Monitoring requirements

Patient parameters

Monitor for hypersensitivity reaction during the first 3 months of treatment—for desensitisation dosing regimen consult product literature.

Monitor liver function—discontinue immediately if signs or symptoms of hepatic toxicity (including rash, fever and gastrointestinal disturbance).

Prepared medicinal forms of AMINOSALICYLIC ACID

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.

Gastro-resistant granules
